subject: Home & DIY
title: Heat Pumps: Air Conditioning in Reverse
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Heat Pumps: Air Conditioning in Reverse.

hook.text: A heat pump doesn't create heatâ€”it moves existing warmth from outside in. Even in freezing air, there's heat to harvest.

buildup.text: Refrigerant absorbs outdoor heat, gets compressed to raise its temperature, then releases that heat indoors.

discovery.text: For every unit of electricity, a heat pump delivers 3-4 units of heat. That's 300-400% efficiencyâ€”no furnace competes.

twist.text: In summer, it reverses: moving indoor heat outside. One device replaces both your furnace and air conditioner.

climax.text: Heat pumps are the fastest-growing home heating tech worldwide, outselling US gas furnaces for the first time in 2023.

punchline.text: It doesn't make heatâ€”it steals it from the air.

quiz.question: How can a heat pump achieve over 100% efficiency?
options: It moves existing heat rather than generating it, multiplying energy input
It uses a chemical reaction that releases bonus energy
It recycles waste heat from its own compressor
